video.title: Dreamland
video.synopsis: Tasked with rush infrastructure projects, employees of the Nation Building Authority walk a tightrope between big ambition and government bureaucracy.

episodes.synopsis: Tony’s efforts to sign a huge international deal are compromised by Rhonda’s decision to re-design the NBA's logo; a mix-up puts Nat in a bind.
episodes.title: Wood for the Trees

episodes.synopsis: Tony is forced to step in when an endangered grass threatens plans; Rhonda tries to overhaul the NBA website, bringing in Karsten and a film crew.
episodes.title: Protected Species

episodes.synopsis: A trip to Canberra pushes Tony into investigating the feasibility of building a very fast train; Amy decides to conduct an office safety audit.
episodes.title: Very Fast Turnover

episodes.synopsis: Tony gets dragged in when a developer wants to double the height of his buildings; Nat’s attempt at conducting a performance review leads to trouble.
episodes.title: Onwards and Upwards

episodes.synopsis: The inclusion of roadside art on a highway creates snafus; Tony’s visit to a school results in the actual launch of Australia’s first space program.
episodes.title: Arts and Minds

episodes.synopsis: Concerned about Tasmania, Jim sends Tony and the team south to attend public forums; Rhonda hires a motivational expert who has some odd ideas.
episodes.title: Then We Can Build It

episodes.synopsis: Tony reflects on his job, from the team's successful launch to coping with coworkers, angry cyclists, plumbing problems and gluten-free muffins.
episodes.title: The First Project

episodes.synopsis: Tony is forced to evaluate plans to expand the Ord River scheme; the team plans a themed anniversary party; Jim makes a shocking announcement.
episodes.title: The Whole Enchilada

episodes.synopsis: Tony resolves to focus on big things in the new year, but small things plague him. Nat's work with a local community leads to a big-budget initiative.
episodes.title: A Fresh Start

episodes.synopsis: A big tunneling project is about to get started after years of careful planning. What could go wrong? Nat makes a fatal error: She asks HR for help.
episodes.title: Shovel's Ready

episodes.synopsis: As the office celebrates Healthy Heart Week, Tony's team justifies the lack of parkland in a new park, and Nat anxiously awaits a package delivery.
episodes.title: Keep Out: Public Property

episodes.synopsis: The government's "Education Nation" announcement is highly lauded, but what exactly is it? Meanwhile, Nat handles a Freedom of Information request.
episodes.title: Dot Dot Dot

episodes.synopsis: After months of work on a large project, Tony gets a request from Jim. Rhonda nominates Nat to be a conference keynote speaker.
episodes.title: Terminal Problems

episodes.synopsis: Tony tries to stay out of a planning dispute. Meanwhile, Rhonda wants to raise the department's online presence through social media.
episodes.title: Starting the Conversation

episodes.synopsis: When a report finds a tunnel project unviable, a new business case must be made. Nat wants to fire an inept employee. Amy trains to be a barista.
episodes.title: Reporting for Duty

episodes.synopsis: Tony tries to take a vacation but is thwarted at every turn. Meanwhile, Karsten complicates plans for an infrastructure conference.
episodes.title: Summit Attempt
